dialogue.speaker: Sarah
dialogue.text: You're writing again. I haven't seen you journal in years.

dialogue.speaker: Evan
dialogue.text: I keep having this dream. The same one, but different each time.

dialogue.speaker: Evan
dialogue.text: I meet someone. Or something. They show me that everything is alive, even the spaces between things.

dialogue.speaker: Sarah
dialogue.text: That sounds beautiful. And a little scary.

dialogue.speaker: Evan
dialogue.text: It's both. Like seeing a color you don't have a name for. Changes how you see all the other colors.

actions.action: writes in journal, words flowing like automatic writing
sits beside him, reading over his shoulder with growing recognition
streams through window, illuminating dust motes that dance like conscious particles
fill with descriptions that blur the line between dream and memory

environment.description: Bedroom at dawn, intimate space where transformation meets daily partnership
environment.mood: tender sharing, mystery within marriage, dreams bleeding into waking life
